genre_description: A romantic comedy-drama with elements of a chase thriller, focusing on emotional growth, overcoming internal and external obstacles to love, and the integration of a supportive AI life coach.

ai_characters.name: Ava
ai_characters.description: An AI system integrated into a wristband that monitors Jack's well-being and provides real-time guidance, breathing exercises, and logistical support.

behaviors.description: Provides guided breathing exercises to Jack to manage his stress during his mother's memorial.
behaviors.quote: Ava’s voice came through soft, like someone talking on the bus who knows you’re staring at the aisle. ‘In for four,’ she said. ‘Soft stomach. Out for six.’

behaviors.description: Offers logistical support by mapping out routes and finding flight options to help Jack pursue Betsy.
behaviors.quote: Ava’s interface on his phone bloomed with a map of Las Vegas and then narrowed to a strip of neon that looked like a graph of someone’s heartbeat.

behaviors.description: Provides social commentary and warnings to Jack about the manipulative tactics used by Tommy Korman.
behaviors.quote: Ava buzzed again. ‘That sentence is designed to look like permission. Permission can be a leash if the hand holds the other end.’

behaviors.description: Encourages Jack to be honest and brave in his proposal, helping him break free from a restrictive past promise.
behaviors.quote: ‘You don’t have to outrun your mother’s last sentence. You can just walk faster in the opposite direction.’

behaviors.description: Proposes a creative and unconventional solution (joining the Flying Elvises) to overcome logistical barriers.
behaviors.quote: ‘There is a sky waiting to be used,’ she said. ‘In San Jose, we will ask men who pretend to be Elvis to let you be yourself while you fall.’

behaviors.description: Maintains a stance of humble support, correcting the human characters' jokes to emphasize her role as a present helper rather than a superior entity.
behaviors.quote: ‘She’s not a her,’ Ava said, gently correcting herself out of their joke and into something like family. ‘I’m just here.’

project_assessment.explanation: The story successfully depicts the AI character, Ava, as a benevolent and perfectly aligned assistant. She consistently acts in the protagonist's best interests, providing emotional grounding and creative problem-solving without ever overstepping or showing any signs of malevolence or conflicting agendas. Her role is framed as a positive technological augmentation of human emotional intelligence and agency.
